title: OMH: Structured Sparsity via Optimally Matched Hierarchy for Unsupervised Semantic Segmentation
abstract: arXiv:2403.06546v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Unsupervised Semantic Segmentation (USS) involves segmenting images without relying on predefined labels, aiming to alleviate the burden of extensive human labeling. Existing methods utilize features generated by self-supervised models and specific priors for clustering. However, their clustering objectives are not involved in the optimization of the features during training. Additionally, due to the lack of clear class definitions in USS, the resulting segments may not align well with the clustering objective. In this paper, we introduce a novel approach called Optimally Matched Hierarchy (OMH) to simultaneously address the above issues. The core of our method lies in imposing structured sparsity on the feature space, which allows the features to encode information with different levels of granularity. translated_title: OMH: 通过最佳匹配层次实现无监督语义分割的结构化稀疏性
translated_abstract: 无监督语义分割（USS）涉及在不依赖预定义标签的情况下对图像进行分割，旨在减轻广泛人工标记的负担。本文介绍了一种名为Optimally Matched Hierarchy（OMH）的新方法，用于同时解决上述问题。我们方法的核心在于在特征空间上施加结构化稀疏性，从而允许特征以不同粒度的信息进行编码。这种稀疏性的结构源自我们的层次结构（OMH）。
tldr: 本文提出一种名为Optimally Matched Hierarchy（OMH）的新方法，通过在特征空间上施加结构化稀疏性，实现了无监督语义分割任务中特征优化的层次匹配。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces a novel approach called Optimally Matched Hierarchy (OMH) that imposes structured sparsity on the feature space, enabling hierarchical matching of features optimization in unsupervised semantic segmentation.
